intro: Nitrophila mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican nitrophila, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, violet-like flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Nitrophila mexicana is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its native habitat.
